posts.name: James Racadio
posts.cooked: New to labview here. I created a simple motor control.vi in which I just followed directions I found online. Is that all I need to do in order to control motors or our shooter? If you could explain the process after you create a new vi that would be beneficial.

posts.name: Mark McLeod
posts.cooked:
The general process is:

Declare motor in Begin.vi and name it for use elsewhere

Control motor in Teleop.vi and Autonomous Independent.vi (automated or shared processes tend to fit better in Periodic Tasks.vi)

If you’ve created a new vi to control a shooter motor with feedback, then that might be best placed in Periodic Tasks.vi in it’s own loop (if it doesn’t already incorporate a loop in the new vi). It’s going to depend on how your new vi is constructed.

posts.name: Oscar
posts.cooked: I strongly recommend taking a look into the Secret Book of FRC LabVIEW . I presume it will be a good resource to get you started with LabVIEW and the robot framework.

posts.name: James Racadio
posts.cooked: So, I created a new vi to control the shooter motors. I used this tutorial and set it up exactly. https://forums.ni.com/t5/FIRST-Robotics-Competition/Basic-Motor-Control-Tutorial/ta-p/3733426?profile.language=en My question is do I need to do anything in Begin.vi and/or Teleop.vi to get this to work?

link_counts.title: Basic Motor Control Tutorial - NI Community

posts.name: mshafer1
posts.cooked:
That link is an example of a test VI - if it runs, great - but you won’t be able to get teleop mode to run it.

(Here’s a “getting started” that goes into setting up a motor for use in teleop and such: FRC Kickoff 2020 LabVIEW Intro Webinar - YouTube )

link_counts.title: FRC Kickoff 2020 LabVIEW Intro Webinar - YouTube

posts.name: James Racadio
posts.cooked: I got it, thanks. Now my question is how do I assign those motors to a button on the controller? We are using an xbox style computer controller. I have the thumb sticks (or directional pad) to control the movement along with the left and right triggers to rotate (we are using mecanum). I would like to use x to activate the shooter motors.
